info.label: Full Stack Developer
info.brief: Mid-Level Full-Stack Developer (3+ years FTE, 9+ OpenSource). Specialities: Networking, Parsing, Application Development. Open Source Expert. Software Dev Generalist. I work best in small, highly specialized teams. Well versed in training, mentorship, and leadership roles.
info.quote: Leave it better than you found it

history.summary: FrontEnd Dev (100% Remote), built the IDE (Typescript) and website UI (React).
highlights: Implemented many of the visual designs represented in the production app
Greatly improved the system for serialization/deserialization of global application state
Implemented the foundations of a plugin framework for 3rd party modules
Contributed solutions for many pain points ex. svg loading, bundle size, scss standardization/performance, etc.
Fixed a regular stream of bugs as well as wrote unit tests (karma) and co-developed the scaffold for E2E testing (selenium)
Worked through the earlier disogranized stages through the initial production launch

history.summary: High speed, low drag copper specialist. Installing/Repairing Century Link DSL/POTS services.
highlights: Served 1K+ customers
Leadership: Provided guidance, training, and QA for the field team

history.summary: DISH Field Technician. Performing satellite installations, repairs, upgrades, and migrations.
highlights: Served 1.5k+ customers

history.summary: West Coast Field Service Representative for MARCORSYSCOM Combat Camera. Supporting all things Logistics and Technical
highlights: Supported 11 Combat Camera units across 6 military installations
Logistics: Fielded, tracked, and supported $5+ million in military hardware
Maintenance: Acted as the regional SME (Subject Matter Expert) for the TIPS (Tactical Imagery Production System)
Training: Hosted of semi-annual traning evolutions for the TIPS
Leadership: Fielded the TIPS on 3 training exercises. Advised unit chiefs/officers and regularly led small teams of Marines
Webmaster: Designed, built, and maintained company's online presence
Credentials: Earned 2 Xerox MFD Certifications and acquired a 'Public Trust' clearance

history.summary: Hacking on commercial full flight aircraft simulators for fun and profit.
highlights: Product Development: Worked as a Principal Developer on the RIOS (Replacement Instructor Operating Station)
Hardware: Designed, implemented, integrated avionics and systems updates. Ex EGPWS, TCAS, TAWS, glass, analog
Webmaster: Designed, built, and maintained the company site. Which led to 2 brokerage deals worth .5MM
Partnered w/ Rotran LTD for many Level D simulator relocations, Roles incl Packer, Electrical, Rigger

history.summary: Build commercial full flight simulators. Avionics, cabling, instrument panels, I/O, and instrument calibrations.
highlights: Build: Manufactured custom cables, wiring harnesses, instrument panels, and modified Electrical Prints
Integration: Installed I/O, and calibrated instruments

Added unit and performance tests
Wrote, revised, and improved documentation

projects.title: RIOS [Proprietary]
projects.summary: A mission critical 3-touchscreen interface for Level D Commercial Flight Simulators.
highlights: Worth 250K in revenue
Product: Worked with the Cx from the first stages to define all UI designs and capabilities
Software: Architect many fundamental systems. UI, IPC, Comms, Database, Multi-Threading, Binary Parsers
Hardware: Fully specified and installed all hardware. Rackmount Computers, Screens, Redundant Backup H/W
Integration: Fully integrated/tested the system with only 7-days of operational downtime
SLA: Acceptance required 90 days @ 99.9% uptime
